title: Delete and Rename Files
description: Learn to manage files by deleting unwanted files and renaming others. Claude Code can help you reorganize your project structure.

initialFiles.content:
# Challenge: Delete and Rename Files

Your task: Clean up this messy project structure

## Objectives
1. Delete the `temp.txt` file (it's not needed)
2. Rename `oldname.js` to `utils.js`
3. Keep `important.js` unchanged

This is a temporary file that should be deleted.
It contains nothing useful.

objectives.description: utils.js should contain the utility functions

hints.text: You can ask Claude Code to delete or rename files. Use natural language to describe what you want.
Try: 'Delete temp.txt and rename oldname.js to utils.js'
Claude Code uses bash commands like 'rm' and 'mv' behind the scenes. Just describe the changes you want.

solution.approach: Describe the file operations you want. Claude Code will execute the appropriate commands.
solution.example: Delete the temp.txt file and rename oldname.js to utils.js
alternativeApproaches: Clean up: remove temp.txt, rename oldname.js to utils.js
Reorganize files: delete temp.txt, move oldname.js to utils.js

learningPoints: Claude Code can delete files when asked
Claude Code can rename/move files to new locations
Always verify important files aren't accidentally modified
